Tigers claws, otherwise known as bagh nakh, were a special type of small weapon unique to the land of Zakhara.
Tigers claws were straps or gloves fitted with spikes, This bar was connected along the wearers palm and back of hand by a metal strip that was attached to another bracelet-type bar that went around the wearerâ€™s wrist.
The claws were were situated in such a way that they emerged between a wearers fingers whenever they made a fist,
Tigers claws were typically used for assassinations, rather than in warfare. The most common form of an attack with them was an upward slash.
Though similar in appearance to the nekode of Kara-tur, tigers claws could not assist their wearer in acts of climbing.
* claws of the shadow An enchanted set of bagh nakh that were used by cultists of Kiga.
* Since these weapons were small and easily concealed, they were favored by slayers and assassins, who often coated the spikes with poison.
In the land of Zakhara a pair of tigers claws generally sold for 6 silver pieces. Outside this region they were considered exotic and thus fetched a much higher price, going as high as 5 gold pieces.
